content.question: Color Wavelength Red <math alttext="647 through 760 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>647</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>760</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Orange <math alttext="585 through 647 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>585</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>647</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Yellow <math alttext="575 through 585 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>575</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>585</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Green <math alttext="491 through 575 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>491</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>575</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Blue <math alttext="424 through 491 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>424</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>491</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Violet <math alttext="300 through 424 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>424</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Using the wavelength information provided above, what is the color of the light?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
